question.text: The flat horizontal line in between the waves of ECG represents time when

options.text: there is no mechanical activity in the heart but there is electrical activity in the heart
there is no electrical activity in the heart but there is mechanical activity in the heart
there is no mechanical activity in the heart and there is no electrical activity in the heart
there is mechanical activity in the heart and there is electrical activity in the heart

solution.text: Electrocardiogram ECG has P wave, QRS complex and T wave. The P wave is an upward wave and indicates atrial depolarisation, QRS complex indicates ventricular depolarization. T wave is an upward wave and indicates ventricular repolarisation. The flat horizontal line is called the isoelectric line. There is no electrical activity, but there will be mechanical activity. Example: ST segment indicates atrial contraction.
